H0.text: Trees absorb these gases, which makes it difficult to prove that an increase of certain gases in the atmosphere is affecting global temperatures, a hypothesis that many scientists are convinced about.

H1.text: Global temperatures are rising as a result of increased atmospheric gases, a hypothesis many scientists believe but find difficult to prove.

H2.text: Many variables affect global temperatures, which makes proving the hypothesis that an increase of certain gases in the atmosphere is affecting global temperatures difficult.

H3.text: Many human activities produce these gases, which makes it difficult to prove that an increase of certain gases in the atmosphere is affecting global temperatures.

A4.text: In 2022, the concentrations of CO2 and methane had increased by about 50% and 164%, respectively, since 1750. These CO2 levels are higher than they have been at any time during the last 14 million years.

A5.text: To determine the human contribution to climate change, unique 'fingerprints' for all potential causes are developed and compared with both observed patterns and known internal climate variability.
